name: contrail
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a white line left in the sky by an aircraft that consists of water vapour (= gas) that has condensed (= turned back into very small drops of water): A contrail slowly fades away over a period of around 60 seconds. Many of the contrails we can see are from jets flying out of a nearby air force base. Synonym
vapour trail
More examplesFewer examplesCirrus clouds appear in the southern sky, along with a distinct contrail.The contrails left by planes are particularly damaging to the global climate. The higher the ambient temperature, the less likely it is that contrails will form.The picture shows a black bird against a blue sky striped by aircraft contrails.
